intro: Tubella broadwayi, commonly known as the Broadway tubella, is a rare and specialized species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, elongated leaves that are often curved or twisted. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including sporophytes, are relatively uncommon and contribute to its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Tubella broadwayi is considered a species of conservation concern.
